channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Walmart Is on a Winning Streak
item.description: It is now the S&P 500’s best-performing retail stock in 2024, and with good reason.

item.title: Six Flags will open seven new roller coasters in 2025
item.description: Six Flags is also expanding its All-Park Passport Add-On, and upgrading food and beverage facilities.

item.title: Investors Still Face Fog of Uncertainty on Economy, Fed
item.description: Markets remain vulnerable to swings in monetary policy expectations.

item.title: Betting markets now see Kamala Harris beating Donald Trump in November
item.description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump’s chances of winning this year’s White House race appear to have declined over the past month, with betting markets now putting his prospects below those of Democratic candidate Kamala Harris.

item.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Takes Ulta Beauty Stake, Sending Shares Up
item.description: The legendary investor added to positions in Chubb and Occidental Petroleum.

item.title: Recession fears in bond market fade after July’s retail-sales data
item.description: Thursday’s surprisingly strong retail-sales data for July took some of the fear of a U.S. recession out of the bond market, sending yields toward their biggest one-day advances in more than a month.

item.title: Mars Megadeal Shows Big Food Wants to Get Bigger
item.description: Mars’s nearly $30 billion deal to buy Pringles maker Kellanova would push the candy company into the chips and cracker aisles and hand it more of the growing global snacks business.

item.title: 6 ways to build a successful retirement
item.description: What people in their 50s, 60s and 70s should know about navigating life after work

item.title: S&P 500 Climbs With Traders Weighing Size of Rate Cut
item.description: Walmart earnings and retail sales on Thursday will offer more clues on the economy.

item.title: Mortgage rates inch up after a big plunge last week. Rates ‘will likely trend down in the coming months,’ Freddie Mac says.
item.description: The 30-year mortgage rate is averaging at 6.49% Freddie Mac said in its latest weekly survey on Thursday.
